name: hectoring
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
talking and behaving in a loud and unpleasantly forceful way, especially in order to get someone to act or think as you want: He had a loud, hectoring manner. Her staff ignored his hectoring emails and phone calls for several months. See
hector
More examplesFewer examplesHe can be chilly and hectoring.Many specialists advise a more subtle, less hectoring approach when it comes to advancing global democracy.The Republican used an aggressive, sometimes hectoring, style.

loud and upleasantly forceful talk or behaviour, especially intended to get someone to act or think as you want: His first marriage broke under the weight of his wife's endless hectoring. His mean-spirited hectoring is a turn off for those who otherwise might support him.
More examplesFewer examplesHis hectoring can get tedious.An essential kindness is clear beneath the hectoring. Alice, worn down by Gilbert's hectoring, turns to drink.
